Table.name: Prescriptions
Table.commentInRDBMS: This table is structured to capture details about medical prescriptions, associating them with specific patients and doctors, recording the date of issuance and expiration, and providing space for any additional notes or instructions associated with the prescription.
Table.beforeCreate: GO IF EXISTS(SELECT * FROM sys.sysobjects WHERE NAME = '{table}' AND xtype = 'U') BEGIN DROP TABLE {schema}.{table}; END GO
Table.endOfScript: INSERT INTO Prescriptions (PrescriptionId, AppointmentId, Observation) VALUES (1, 1, 'Discovered elevated blood pressure during examination. Recommend monitoring and lifestyle changes.') INSERT INTO Prescriptions (PrescriptionId, AppointmentId, Observation) VALUES (2, 2, 'Identified vitamin D deficiency. Suggested daily supplementation of 1000 IU.') INSERT INTO Prescriptions (PrescriptionId, AppointmentId, Observation) VALUES (3, 3, 'Patient reported difficulty sleeping. Advised practicing good sleep hygiene habits.')

Column.name: PrescriptionId
Column.commentInRDBMS: A unique identifier for each prescription.

Column.name: AppointmentId
Column.commentInRDBMS: An identifier that associates this prescription with a specific appointment or medical visit.

Column.name: Observation
Column.commentInRDBMS: A field used to store observations or notes related to the prescription.
